subject: Re: [junit] Re: Categories in 4.8, how can I avoid specifying classes 	in @Suite.SuiteClasses
msgSnippet: Hi David. Yes, Categorization of tests are working very well now, thanks! I ve documented the solution here
messageBody:
Hi David.

Yes, Categorization of tests are working very well now, thanks!
I've documented the solution here
http://wiki.cantara.no/display/KM/How+to+use+JUnit+Categories+to+implement+JigZaw
Please feel free to copy this into the JUnit docs, if needed.

Best regards
B�rd Lind



On Tue, Dec 15, 2009 at 3:19 PM, David Saff <david@...> wrote:

>
>
> B�rd,
>
> We imagined the categories between the class and method as being
> purely additive. I didn't even consider the possibility of a pure
> override. Are things working for you now?
>
> David Saff
>
>
> On Tue, Dec 15, 2009 at 3:49 AM, B�rd Lind <bard.lind@...<bard.lind%40gmail.com>>
> wrote:
> > Hi David!
> >
> > Thank you very much for your answer.
> > On my first test-run, I the tests I didn't want to run actually ran. The
> > "error" or feature were caused by defining Categories at Class level in
> my
> > actual
> > Test class.
> > ....
> > @Category({SlowTests.class,FastTests.class})
> > public class AppTest {
> > ....
> > }
> > ...
> > There seems like Class-level categories overrides test-level categories.
> I
> > expected the opposite to happen...
> >
> > The solution that works:
> >
> > 1. The Suite to be run for slow tests:
> > @RunWith(Categories.class)
> > @...(SlowTests.class)
> > @...({AllTests.class})
> > public class OnlySlowTests {
> > }
> >
> > 2. "Proxy" to include all tests:
> > @RunWith(ClasspathSuite.class)
> > public class AllTests {
> > }
> >
> > 3. Example of Test class:
> > public class AppTest {
> > @Test
> > @Category({FastTests.class})
> > public void fast() {
> > assertEquals("Fast test", 1,2);
> > }
> >
> > @Test
> > @Category({SlowTests.class})
> > public void slow() {
> > assertEquals("Slow test", 1,2);
> > }
> > }
> >
> >
> > Thanks again, David.
> >
> > B�rd
> >
> >
> > On Tue, Dec 15, 2009 at 4:34 AM, David Saff <david@...<david%40saff.net>>
> wrote:
> >
> >>
> >>
> >> B�rd,

> this:

> >>
> >> }
> >>
> >> @RunWith(Categories.class)
> >> @...(SlowTests.class)
> >> @...({AllTests.class})
> >> public class OnlySlowTests {
> >> }
> >>
> >> David Saff
